juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Antecedent module

T1_Antecedent.py Created 18/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Antecedent.T1_Antecedent(mF: juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Interface.T1MF_Interface, input_: juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input, name: str)[source]

Bases: object

Class T1_Antecedent: Antecedent for a fuzzy rule of a Type-1 Fuzzy System.

Parameters

  • mF – The actual membership function to associated with this antecedent.

  • input – The input to associate with this antecedent.

  • name – Name of the antecedent

Functions:

setMF getMF getInput getName setName getFS getMax compareTo toString

compareTo(o: object) → int[source]

Allows the comparison of two antecedents, based on their membership functions.

getFS() → float[source]

Returns the firing strength for the given antecedent using the current input supplied.

getInput() → juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input[source]

Get the input of the antecedent

getMF() → juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Interface.T1MF_Interface[source]

Get the membership function defining the antecedent

getMax(tNorm: int) → float[source]

Returns the arg sup of the t-norm between the membership function of the antecedent and the membership function of the input (in case of NSF)

getName() → str[source]

Get the name of the antecedent

setMF(mF: juzzyPython.type1.sets.T1MF_Interface.T1MF_Interface) → None[source]

Allows changing the membership function defining the antecedent

setName(name: str) → None[source]

Set the name of the antecedent

toString() → str[source]

Converts antecedent to string

juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule module

T1_Rule.py Created 19/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule(antecedents: List[juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Antecedent.T1_Antecedent], consequent: Optional[juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Consequent.T1_Consequent] = None, consequents: Optional[List[juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Consequent.T1_Consequent]] = None)[source]

Bases: object

Class T1_Rule: Rule for a Type-1 Fuzzy System.

Parameters

  • Antecedents – The array of antecedents

  • Consequent – The consequent (only a single consequent is supported here)

  • Consequents – The array of consequents

Functions:

getNumberOfAntecedents getNumberOfConsequents getAntecedents getConsequents getInputs compareBasedOnAntecedents getFStrength toString

compareBasedOnAntecedents(r: juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule) → bool[source]

Performs a comparison operation by comparing the rule objects solely based on their antecedents. The method returns true of the antecedents of both rules are the same.

getAntecedents() → List[juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Antecedent.T1_Antecedent][source]

Return the list of antecedents

getConsequents() → List[juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Consequent.T1_Consequent][source]

Return the list of consequents

getFStrength(tNorm: int) → float[source]

Returns the rule’s firing strength. The method relies on the transparent updating of the inputs of the fuzzy system through the Input classes attached to the antecedents.

getInputs() → List[juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input][source]

Return the list of inputs

getNumberOfAntecedents() → int[source]

Return the number of antecedents

getNumberOfConsequents() → int[source]

Return the number of consequents

toString() → str[source]

Convert antecedent to string

juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rulebase module

T1_Rulebase.py Created 19/12/2021

class juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rulebase.T1_Rulebase[source]

Bases: object

Class T1_Rulebase: Class Capturing an entire Type-1 FLS through its rules.

Parameters:None

Functions:

addRule getNumberOfOutputs getNumberOfRules getInferenceMethod setInferenceMethod getImplicationMethod setImplicationMethod getRule getInputs getOutputSetBuffers evaluate centroidDefuzzification heightDefuzzification getRules changeRule removeRule toString

addRule(r: juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule) → None[source]

add a rule to the set and buffers

centroidDefuzzification() → dict[source]

Inference and Centroid Defuzzification

changeRule(ruleNum: int, newRule: juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule) → None[source]

Change a current rule

evaluate(defuzzType: int) → dict[source]

Returns defuzzified result of evaluating all rules in the rulebase. param defuzzificationType The type of defuzzifier to be used: 0-Height Defuzzification, 1-Centroid Defuzzification. param discretizationLevel The discretization level to be employed (only applies to centroid defuzzification)

getImplicationMethod() → str[source]

Returns the current Implication Method as used for all rules.

getInferenceMethod() → str[source]

Returns the current Inference Method as used for all rules.

getInputs() → List[juzzyPython.generic.Input.Input][source]

This method assumes all rules use the same (and all) inputs. The first rule is queried to identify the inputs and return them. return a list of the inputs used in the rulebase (retrieved from the antecedents of the first rule in the rulebase!).

getNumberOfOutputs() → int[source]

Get the number of output buffers

getNumberOfRules() → int[source]

Get the number of rules

getOutputSetBuffers() → dict[source]

Returns the outputSetBuffers

getRule(r: juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule) → juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule[source]

Return a specific rule

getRules() → List[juzzyPython.type1.system.T1_Rule.T1_Rule][source]

Get the list of rules

heightDefuzzification() → dict[source]

Inference and Height Defuzzification

removeRule(ruleNum: int) → None[source]

Remove a rule from the set

setImplicationMethod(implicationMethod: int) → None[source]

Sets the implication method, where by implication, we mean the implementation of the AND logical connective between parts of the antecedent. The desired implication method is applied for all rules.

setInferenceMethod(inferenceMethod: int) → None[source]

Sets the inference method, where by inference, we mean the implementation of applying the rule’s firing strength to the consequent. The desired inference method is applied for all rules.

toString() → str[source]

Convert all the rules to string
